turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Hussain al-Shahristani.
turn.1: What did Hussain al-Shahristani do in the UK?
turn.2: He escaped from Abu Ghraib during the 1991 Gulf War and went to Iran, where he left for UK.
turn.4: He obtained his freedom in an extremely daring 'Hollywood' style escape plan which was conceived, orchestrated and implemented by him.
turn.5: What did he do after escaping?
turn.6: He went on to set up humanitarian aid organisations for the millions of Iraqi refugees during the Saddam era.
turn.8: Having spent more than a decade (1979–1991) as a political prisoner in the infamous Abu Ghraib prison under the regime of Saddam, he escaped during an allied bombing raid on Baghdad during the First Gulf War.
turn.10: H.E. al-Shahristani fled to Iran where he served as head of the Gulf War Victims Organization from 1991 to 1995.
turn.11: Did he do anything after that?
turn.12: He later continued his support for the victims of Saddams's regime and the Gulf War as head of the Iraqi Political Prisoners Union (2003) and as Chief of the Iraqi Refugees Relief Committee (1998–2003).
